sub_title: Data encryption,user privacy,cybersecurity,privacy-preserving federated learning,blockchain;Fellow of The Higher Education Academy; NEN member 381027 “Cybersecurity & Privacy”;associate editor;cybersecurity consultant
summary:
Dr. Liang is a tenured faculty member of the Cybersecurity group at Delft University of Technology. He received his PhD degree in computer science from Department of Computer Science at City University of Hong Kong. With over 11 years experiences on cybersecurity R&D, his main focus is on the design and implementation of cryptographic protocols to security. He has involved (as PI and CI) in several European funded projects and H2020 proposals, e.g., TANGO, ASSURED, IRIS, Academic of Finland, and delivered real-world impact via these projects with his academic and industrial partners. He has also maintained a tight and strong research relationships with Europe, Asia-pacific and northern America academic communities. He has published a series of research works (> 100 publications, > 3,800 citations), applying information security and crypto tools to tackle real-world problems, in many high-tier international information security journals and conferences (top 5 rankings based on Google's Computer Security & Cryptography ranking), e.g., ESORICS (best research paper award), CVPR, USENIX Security, NDSS, IEEE TIFS, and IEEE TDSC. He has served as technical program committee for over 25 renowned international security/privacy conferences, e.g., Euro S&P, ESORICS, ACNS, ASIACCS. He has contributed to ISO standards as an NEN member of the standards committee 381027 “Cybersecurity & Privacy”. In addition to being an active reviewer for many international journals/conferences, he also serves as associate editor, e.g., for the Computer Journal, guest editor, e.g., for the Journal of Computer Security, IEEE Transactions on industrial informatics, and cybersecurity consultant for SMEs.
